author: dlr
msg: On the sparse-directories branch: Tweak the new reporter APIs,
removing the (ignored) "user name" parameter and (unnecessary) depth
Depth is specified by the reporter's set_path() and link_path() APIs,
rather than when beginning a report.  This is a divergence from the
"recurse" parameter which is part of the old svn_repos_begin_report()
(svn_repos_begin_report2): Update doc string.  Drop USERNAME and
(svn_repos_begin_report): Update doc string, noting that USERNAME is
(drive): Use the depth associated with the path info when calling
(write_path_info): If the passed in DEPTH is unknown, default to the
(begin_report): New helper API factored out of svn_repos_begin_report2().
(svn_repos_begin_report2): Drop parameters, and delegate to begin_report()
with a depth of svn_depth_infinity (which might be better off as
SVN_DEPTH_FROM_RECURSE() to convert the RECURSE parameter into the
(svn_wc_crawl_revisions3): Allow the passed-in DEPTH to override the
depth of an entry for calls to the reporter API.
